	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:20PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Total estimated tangible and intangible net assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	14,083
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="3" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Goodwill of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$4.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;represents the value of expected synergies between us and EnergyHub and is calculated as the total consideration less tangible and intangible net assets, including the value of acquired workforce. We estimate that goodwill will not be deductible for tax purposes. Our estimate of the fair value of tangible and intangible net assets was developed using a multi-period excess earnings method for customer relationships and the relief from royalty method for the developed technology intangible. Significant estimates used in the valuation included revenue growth rates, expense and contributory asset charges, royalty rates and the discount rate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Management determined the estimated fair value of the contingent earn-out payments to be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$5.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Payment of the earn-out consideration was principally contingent upon EnergyHub achieving certain agreed upon revenue targets during 2013 through 2015 and, if EnergyHub achieved those targets, we would be required to make payments at the end of 2013, 2014 and 2015 up to a maximum amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$16.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. See &#8220;Impairment&#8221; below for a discussion of the treatment of the earn-out in 2013 through 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Fair Value of Net Assets Acquired and Intangibles
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In accordance with ASC 805, the assets and liabilities of EnergyHub we acquired were recorded at their respective fair values as of May&#160;7, 2013, the date of the acquisition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Customer Relationships
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;83
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage86"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;" HREF="#ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SAB9468B74ED751D9BE5972D4050A393A">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ALARM.COM HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements - (Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The customer relationships intangible was recorded separate from goodwill based on determination of the length, strength and contractual nature of the relationship that EnergyHub shared with its customers. We valued this customer relationship information using the multi-period excess earnings method, an income approach. We used several assumptions in the income approach, including revenue growth, a customer retention rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	75 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, operating expenses, charge for contributory assets and trade name, and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	24 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;discount rate used to calculate the present value of the cash flows. The customer relationships, valued at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$4.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, are being amortized on a straight-line basis over the estimated useful life of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	4.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Developed Technology
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Developed technology recorded separately from goodwill consists of intellectual property such as proprietary software used internally for revenue producing activities. EnergyHub&#8217;s proprietary software, Mercury, is offered for sale on a SaaS hosted basis to customers and has an established revenue stream. The developed technology was valued by applying the relief from royalty method, an income approach. We used several assumptions in the relief from royalty method, including revenue growth, a royalty rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	7 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	24 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;discount rate used to calculate the present value of cash flows. The developed technology, valued at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, is being amortized on a straight-line basis over an estimated useful life of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	7.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Trade Name
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The EnergyHub trade name was recorded separate from goodwill based on an evaluation of the importance of the trade name and the brand recognition in the market, the importance of the trade name to the EnergyHub&#8217;s customers, and the amount of revenue associated with the trade name. In developing the estimated fair value, we valued the trade name utilizing the relief from royalty method, an income approach. Significant assumptions used in the relief from royalty method were revenue growth, royalty rate, and the discount rate to calculate the present value of cash flows. The trade name, valued at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, is being amortized on a straight-line basis over the estimated useful life of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#160;years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Impairment and Earn-out Obligation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	A triggering event occurred in September 2013 that indicated an impairment of intangibles and goodwill had occurred related to our EnergyHub reporting unit. We determined that a potential strategic partnership agreement which was expected to contribute a material amount of revenue over the earn-out period was no longer expected to be executed. Therefore, EnergyHub&#8217;s revenue over the earn-out period was expected to be materially less than originally estimated at the time of the acquisition. Revenue from this potential strategic partnership represented a material percentage of the revenue growth assumptions included in the forecast used to assign fair value to the customer relationships, developed technology and trade name. As a result, we prepared an interim review of the carrying value of goodwill and other intangible assets. The business failed step one of the goodwill impairment test, and we performed step two to determine the amount of the impairments. Under step one of the impairment analysis, EnergyHub was valued using the discounted cash flow method. To estimate the value of our total invested capital, the debt-free after tax cash flows for EnergyHub were discounted by a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	25 percent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;required rate of return. We used the guideline company method to assess the reasonableness of this value. The total invested capital was compared to our carrying value to determine whether goodwill was impaired as indicated when the carrying value of EnergyHub is higher than the estimated value. The carrying value of the finite lived intangible assets (customer relationships, developed technology and trade name intangibles) were compared to the sum of our pre-tax and undiscounted cash flows, and we determined that the goodwill and intangible assets were impaired. We recognized an impairment charge for goodwill of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$4.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and intangible assets of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$6.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, which are recorded in general and administrative expense for the year ended December&#160;31, 2013 in our consolidated statement of operations. Due to the triggering event, EnergyHub&#8217;s revenue results were expected to be materially less than the revenue targets established in the earn-out agreement. Therefore we determined that the earn-out fair value was zero for 2013 through 2015. We recorded a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$5.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;gain on the release of the contingent liability in general and administrative expense for the year ended December&#160;31, 2013 in our consolidated statement of operations. The earn-out had a fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;as of December&#160;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Unaudited Pro Forma Information
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The following pro forma data is presented as if (1) EnergyHub was included in our historical consolidated statements of operations beginning January 1, 2012, (2) Secure-i and Horizon Analog were included in our historical consolidated statements of operations beginning January&#160;1, 2013 and (3) SecurityTrax was included in our historical consolidated statements of operations beginning January 1, 2014. These pro forma results do not necessarily represent what would have occurred if all the business combinations had taken place on January&#160;1, 2012, 2013 and 2014, as applicable, nor do they represent the results that may occur in the future.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	This pro forma financial information includes our historical financial statements and those of our business combinations with the following adjustments: (1) we adjusted for amortization expense assuming the fair value adjustments to intangible assets had been applied beginning January&#160;1, 2012, 2013 and 2014, as applicable; (2) we adjusted for transaction costs incurred in 2015, 2014 and 2013 and reclassified them to 2014, 2013 and 2012, respectively, as applicable, and (3) we included adjustments for income taxes associated with these pro forma adjustments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;84
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<TD COLSPAN="3" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2015
</FONT>

	year

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In March 2015, we acquired SecurityTrax and recorded $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of goodwill in the Alarm.com segment (See Note 6). In December 2014, we acquired Secure-i and Horizon Analog and recorded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of goodwill in the Alarm.com segment (See Note 6).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;impairments of goodwill recorded during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	s ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. In the third quarter of 2013, we experienced a triggering event related to EnergyHub, which resulted in testing goodwill for impairment and subsequently recording a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$4.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;goodwill impairment charge in general and administrative expense in the consolidated statement of operations for the year ended December 31, 2013 (See Note 6).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The following table reflects changes in the net carrying amount of the components of intangible assets for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	s ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;(in thousands):
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	For the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, we recorded $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of amortization related to our intangible assets. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;impairments of long-lived assets during the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014. During the third quarter of 2013, we experienced a triggering event related to EnergyHub and recorded an intangible asset impairment charge of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$6.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in general and administrative expense in the consolidated statement of operations for the year ended December 31, 2013 (See Note 6).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The following tables reflect the weighted-average remaining life and carrying value of finite-lived intangible assets as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;(in thousands):
</FONT>

</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 8. Investments in Other Entities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cost Method Investment in Connected Home Service Provider
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We own
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	20,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;Series A Convertible Preferred Membership Units and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2,667
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;Series B Convertible Preferred Membership units of a Brazilian connected home solutions provider, which represents an interest of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	12.4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;on a fully diluted basis, and was purchased for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. On April 15, 2015, we purchased an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2,333
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of Series B-1 Convertible Preferred Membership Units at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$23.31
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per unit or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, which increased our aggregate equity interest to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	12.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;on a fully diluted basis. The entity resells our products and services to residential and commercial customers in Brazil. Based upon the level of equity investment at
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;86
</FONT>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage89"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;" HREF="#ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SAB9468B74ED751D9BE5972D4050A393A">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ALARM.COM HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements - (Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	risk, the connected home service provider is a VIE. We do not control the marketing, sales, installation, or customer maintenance functions of the entity and therefore do not direct the activities of the entity that most significantly impact its economic performance. We have determined that we are not the primary beneficiary of the entity and do not consolidate its financial results into ours. We account for this investment using the cost method. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, the fair value of this cost method investment was not estimated as there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;events or changes in circumstances that may have had a significant adverse effect on the fair value of the investment. The $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;investment balance is included in other assets in our consolidated balance sheets as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Investments in and Loans to an Installation Partner
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We own
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	48,190
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;common units of an installation partner, which represents an interest of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	48.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;on a fully diluted basis, and was purchased for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$1.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. The entity performs installation services for security dealers, as well as subsidiaries reported in our Other segment. Based upon the level of equity investment at risk, we determined that the installation partner was not a VIE. We accounted for this investment under the equity method because we have the ability to exercise significant influence over the operating and financial policies of the entity. Under the equity method, we recognize our share of the earnings or losses of the installation partner in other (expense) / income, net in our consolidated statements of operations in the periods they are reported by the installation partner.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;In September 2014, we loaned
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$315,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;to our installation partner under a secured promissory note that accrues interest at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	8.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. The note receivable is included in other current assets in our consolidated balance sheets. Interest is payable monthly with the entire principal balance plus accrued but unpaid interest due at maturity in September 2016. This event did not cause us to reconsider our conclusion that the installation partner had sufficient equity investment at risk and therefore was not a VIE. We continued to account for the investment under the equity method.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In the fourth quarter of 2015, accumulated operating losses at our installation partner exceeded its equity contributions, and we began to record
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of its net losses, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$230,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, against our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$315,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;note receivable.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On December 11, 2015, we purchased an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	9,290
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;common units of the same company for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, which did not change our proportional share of ownership interest. This event caused us to reconsider our conclusions that the installation partner has sufficient equity investment at risk and we now consider the installation partner to be a VIE. We do not control the ability to obtain funding, the annual operating plan, marketing, sales or cash management functions of the entity and therefore do not direct the activities of the entity that most significantly impact its economic performance. We have determined that we are not the primary beneficiary of our installation partner and do not consolidate its financial results into ours. We continue to account for the investment under the equity method. Due to this investment, the investment partner received additional equity contributions, and we returned to recording our share of its earnings or losses against our investment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The loss in other (expense) / income, net was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;million for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. The $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;investment, net of equity losses, is included in other assets in our consolidated balance sheets and was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. The note receivable is included in other current assets in our consolidated balance sheets and was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;the note receivable was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and was included in other assets in our consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Investments in and Loans to a Platform Partner
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We have invested in the form of loans and equity investments in a platform partner which produces connected devices to provide it with the capital required to bring its devices to market and integrate them onto our connected home platform.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In 2013, a previous loan to the platform partner in the form of a note of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$250,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;plus accrued interest automatically converted into preferred shares during a qualified financing event where we paid $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in cash to purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3,548,820
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our platform partner&#8217;s Series A convertible preferred shares, or an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	18.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;interest on as-converted and fully diluted basis. The terms of our investment in the convertible preferred shares included a freestanding option to make an additional investment in the platform partner (the "2013 Option"). We also loaned the same platform partner
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in the form of a secured convertible note (the "2013 Note"). The 2013 Note converted automatically into equity at a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	12.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;discount from the price per share at which new shares of capital stock are issued by the platform provider in a qualified financing (the "Automatic Conversion Feature").
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We recorded the 2013 Option at its initial fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. The 2013 Option did not meet the definition of derivative as it was private company stock that was not readily convertible into cash and therefore, was not measured at fair value at each reporting period. The investment in the Series A convertible preferred shares was recorded at its initial fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and accounted for it as a cost method investment. The 2013 Note was accounted for as an available for sale security and was recorded at fair value in marketable securities at an initial fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$1.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. For the year ended December 31, 2013, we recorded an unrealized gain of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$92,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, net of tax of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$36,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, in our consolidated statement of comprehensive income related to change in fair value. The Automatic Conversion Feature was an embedded derivative that required bifurcation from the 2013 Note. It was recorded at its initial fair value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in other assets as a marketable security and was remeasured at fair value each reporting period with changes recorded in other (expense) / income, net. For the year ended December 31, 2013, we recorded a gain of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$63,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in other (expense) / income, net in our consolidated statement of operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;87

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In 2014, we entered into a Series 1 Preferred Stock purchase agreement with the platform partner and another investor. The other investor invested cash to purchase shares of the platform partner&#8217;s Series 1 Preferred Stock. As a result of the purchase, our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3,548,820
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of Series A convertible preferred shares converted into
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3,548,820
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock, and we hold an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	8.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;interest in the platform partner on an as-converted and fully diluted basis. In conjunction with the transaction, we received a $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;dividend that we recorded as a return of investment as it was in excess of the accumulated earnings and profits of the investee since the date of the investment. Additionally, the platform partner repaid the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;2013 Note and accrued interest of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and as a result, the Automatic Conversion Feature expired. As a result of the transaction, we recorded a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$62,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;realized gain on the 2013 Note, our 2013 Option and Automatic Conversion feature expired and we recognized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$200,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$125,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of impairment losses in other (expense) / income, net in our consolidated statement of operations for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Based upon the level of equity investment at risk, the platform partner is a VIE. We have concluded that we are not the primary beneficiary of the platform partner VIE. We do not control the product design, software development, manufacturing, marketing, or sales functions of the platform partner and, therefore, we do not direct the activities of the platform partner that most significantly impact its economic performance. We account for this investment under the cost method. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, the fair value of this cost method investment was not estimated as there were no events or changes in circumstances that may have had a significant adverse effect on the fair value of the investment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, our $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;cost method investment in a platform partner was recorded in other assets in our consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SF8D229D8C42D570EAA8B0CA85FCEDDEF">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 9. Other Assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Patent Licenses
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	From time to time, we enter into agreements to license patents. We have $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in patent licenses related to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;such agreements. We are amortizing the patent licenses over the estimated useful lives of the patents, which range from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	eleven
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;years. The net balance as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Amortization expense on patent licenses was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for each of the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and is included in cost of SaaS and license revenue in our consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Loan to a Distribution Partner
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In 2013, we entered into a revolving loan agreement with a distribution partner. The distribution partner is also a service provider with whom we have a standard agreement to resell our connected home service and hardware. We evaluate the credit quality of our distribution partner for purposes of the revolving loan agreement using the same methods that we employ to evaluate its creditworthiness as a service provider, including a credit review at the inception of the arrangement and if risk indicators arise. At the inception of the loan agreement, we determined the credit quality of our distribution partner to be good. No risk indicators have arisen to cause us to change that assessment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Under the terms of the revolving loan agreement, we agreed to loan our distribution partner up to $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, with the proceeds of the loan used to finance the creation of new customer accounts that use our products and services. The amount that our distribution partner may draw down on the loan is based on the number of its qualifying new customer accounts created each month. The loan bears interest at a rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	8.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#160;per annum, and requires monthly interest payments, with the entire principal balance due on the loan maturity date, July&#160;24, 2018. The balance outstanding under the loan is collateralized by the customer accounts owned by our distribution partner, as well as all of the physical assets and accounts receivable associated with those customer accounts. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, our distribution partner has borrowed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;under this loan agreement, respectively, and this note receivable is included in other assets on our consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Deferred Offering Costs
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Deferred offering costs of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, consisting primarily of legal and accounting fees, were included in other assets on the consolidated balance sheets as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Upon the consummation of the IPO on July 1, 2015, aggregate deferred offering costs of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$5.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;were offset against the proceeds of the offering.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Marketable Securities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We disposed of our marketable securities during the year ended December&#160;31, 2014 and there were no marketable securities outstanding as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In 2014, we received repayment of the 2013 Note (see Note 8) and recorded a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$62,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;realized gain in other (expense) / income, net. Consequently, the Automatic Conversion Feature (see Note 8) expired and we recorded a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$125,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;impairment loss in other (expense) / income, net. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;other-than-temporary impairments recognized in accumulated other comprehensive income in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;88
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	762
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The money market account is included in our cash and cash equivalents in our consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The liability for the subsidiary unit awards relates to agreements established with the presidents of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of our subsidiaries, who are also our employees, for cash awards contingent upon the subsidiary companies meeting certain financial milestones. Before our IPO, we used the intrinsic method available to non-public companies under ASC 718,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	"Compensation - Stock Compensation"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;to account for our liability for our subsidiary units. After our IPO, we have accounted for these subsidiary awards using fair value. The effect of this change had an immaterial impact to our consolidated financial statements. We established liabilities for the future payment for the repurchase of subsidiary units under the terms of the agreements based on estimating revenue, working capital, EBITDA and EBITDA margin of the subsidiary units for the periods of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;awards. We estimated the fair value of each liability by using a Monte Carlo simulation model for determining each of the projected measures by using an expected distribution of potential outcomes. The fair value of each liability is calculated with thousands of projected outcomes, the results of which are averaged and then discounted to estimate the present value. At each reporting date until the respective payment dates, we will remeasure these liabilities, using the same valuation approach based on the applicable subsidiary's revenue, and we will record any changes in general and administrative expense. The liability balances are included in our other liabilities in our consolidated balance sheets (See Note 12).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The amount of contingent consideration liability to be paid, up to a maximum of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, from our acquisition of SecurityTrax in the first quarter of 2015, will be determined based on revenue and adjusted EBITDA for the year ended December 31, 2017. We estimated the fair value of the contingent consideration liability by using a Monte Carlo simulation model for determining projected revenue by using an expected distribution of potential outcomes. The fair value of contingent consideration liability is calculated with thousands of projected revenue outcomes, the results of which are averaged and then
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;89
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

	ALARM.COM HOLDINGS, INC.

	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	discounted to estimate the present value. At each reporting date until payment in first quarter of 2018, we will remeasure the contingent consideration liability, using the same valuation approach based on our subsidiary&#8217;s revenue, an unobservable input, and we will record any changes in general and administrative expense. The contingent consideration liability balance is included in our other liabilities in our consolidated balance sheets (See Note 6).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We monitor the availability of observable market data to assess the appropriate classification of financial instruments within the fair value hierarchy. Changes in economic conditions or model-based valuation techniques may require the transfer of financial instruments from one fair value level to another. In such instances, the transfer is reported at the beginning of the reporting period. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;transfers between Levels 1, 2 or 3 during the years ended

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. We also monitor the value of the investments for other-than-temporary impairment on a quarterly basis.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;other-than-temporary impairments occurred during the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>

	.

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	For the year ended

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	. The remeasurement of the goodwill and other long-lived assets is classified as a Level 3 fair value assessment due to the significance of unobservable inputs developed in the determination of fair value.

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The components of other liabilities (in thousands):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:92.3828125%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_S5FAAE1503A845801BEEFF886FB5B730F">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 12. Debt, Commitments and Contingencies
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The debt, commitments and contingencies described below are currently in effect and would require us, or our subsidiaries, to make payments to third parties under certain circumstances.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Debt
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Prior Facility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In 2011, we entered into a Loan &amp; Security Agreement with Silicon Valley Bank ("SVB"). We borrowed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$10.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;under a term loan (the "Prior Facility") to be repaid in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	sixty
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;monthly installments of principal and accrued interest. We had the option to prepay the Prior Facility without penalty provided that the Prior Facility had been outstanding for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;or more years. Absent a prepayment, the Prior Facility would have terminated on the date of the last required principal payment, which was December 1, 2016. This facility was extinguished and repaid in May 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	2014 Facility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On May&#160;8, 2014, we repaid all of the outstanding principal and interest under the Prior Facility, which was accounted for as an extinguishment of debt, and replaced it with a $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	50.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;revolving credit facility (the &#8220;2014 Facility&#8221;) with SVB, as administrative agent, and a syndicate of lenders.&#160;We utilized $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	6.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;under the 2014 Facility to repay in full our indebtedness under the Prior Facility. The 2014 Facility includes an option to increase the borrowing capacity available under the 2014 Facility to $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	75.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;with the consent of the lenders. The 2014 Facility is available to us to finance working capital and certain permitted acquisitions and investments, and is secured by substantially all of our assets, including our intellectual property. The principal outstanding under the 2014 Facility is due upon maturity in May 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;90
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;" HREF="#ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SAB9468B74ED751D9BE5972D4050A393A">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ALARM.COM HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements - (Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The outstanding principal balance on the 2014 Facility accrues interest at a rate equal to either (1)&#160;the Eurodollar Base Rate, or LIBOR, plus an applicable margin based on our consolidated leverage ratio, or (2)&#160;the higher of (a)&#160;the Wall Street Journal prime rate and (b)&#160;the Federal Funds rate plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;plus an applicable margin based on our consolidated leverage ratio, or ABR, at our option.&#160;Borrowings under LIBOR rates accrue interest at LIBOR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, LIBOR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, and LIBOR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;when our consolidated leverage ratio is less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, greater than or equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00 but less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, and greater than or equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, respectively.&#160;Borrowings under ABR rates accrue interest at ABR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, ABR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, and ABR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;when our consolidated leverage ratio is less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, greater than or equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00 but less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, and greater than or equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, respectively.&#160;The 2014 Facility also carries an unused line commitment fee of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;depending on our consolidated leverage ratio. For the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, the effective interest rate on the 2014 Facility was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.63%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. The carrying value of 2014 Facility was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	6.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and 2014. The 2014 Facility includes a variable interest rate that approximates market and, as such, we determined that the carrying amount of the 2014 Facility approximates its fair value.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On December 7, 2015, we amended the 2014 Facility. The amendment reduces the rate at which borrowings under LIBOR rates accrue interest to LIBOR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, LIBOR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, and LIBOR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;when our consolidated leverage ratio is less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, greater than or equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00 but less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, and greater than or equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, respectively. Borrowings under ABR rates accrue interest at ABR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, ABR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, and ABR plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;when our consolidated leverage ratio is less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, greater than or equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00 but less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, and greater than or equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00, respectively.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The 2014 Facility contains various financial and other covenants that require us to maintain a maximum consolidated leverage ratio not to exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00 and a consolidated fixed charge coverage ratio of at least
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	:1.00. During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, we were in compliance with all financial and non-financial covenants and there were no events of default.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Commitments and Contingencies
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Repurchase of Subsidiary Units
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In 2012, we formed a subsidiary to develop and market home and commercial energy management devices and services. We granted an award of subsidiary stock to the founder and president. The terms of the award for the founder, who is also our employee, require a payment in cash on either the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	third
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;or the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	fourth
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;anniversary from the date the subsidiary first makes its products and services commercially available, which was determined to be April&#160;1, 2014. The vesting of the award is based on the subsidiary meeting certain minimum financial targets. We recorded a liability of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;related to this commitment in other liabilities in our consolidated balance sheets as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In 2011, we formed a subsidiary that offers to professional residential property management and vacation rental management companies technology solutions for remote monitoring and control of properties, including access control and energy management. We granted an award of subsidiary stock to the founder and president. The terms of the award for the founder, who is our employee, require a payment in cash between the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	fourth
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	sixth
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;anniversary of the date that the subsidiary&#8217;s products and services first become commercially available, which was determined to be June&#160;1, 2013. The vesting of the award is based on the subsidiary meeting certain minimum financial targets. We have recorded a liability of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;related to the commitment in other liabilities in our consolidated balance sheets as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	At each reporting date until the respective payment dates, we will remeasure these liabilities, and we will record any changes in fair value in general and administrative expense. The liability balances are included in our other liabilities in our consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Leases
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We lease office space and office equipment under non-cancelable operating leases with various expiration dates through 2026. In August 2014, we signed a lease for new office space to relocate our headquarters to Tysons, Virginia. The relocation occurred in February 2016. The lease term ends in 2026 and the lease includes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	-year renewal option, an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$8.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;tenant improvement allowance and scheduled rent increases. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, we have utilized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$5.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of the tenant improvement allowance. Rent expense was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$4.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$1.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;for the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The following table presents the future minimum lease payments under the non-cancelable operating leases at December 31, 2015 (in thousands):
</FONT>
</DIV>

	&#32;91
