</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	40,378
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Indemnification Agreements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We have various agreements that may obligate us to indemnify the other party to the agreement with respect to certain matters. Generally, these indemnification provisions are included in contracts arising in the normal course of business. Although we cannot predict the maximum potential amount of future payments that may become due under these indemnification agreements, we do not believe any potential liability that might arise from such indemnity provisions is probable or material.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Legal Proceedings
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On June 2, 2015, Vivint, Inc. filed a lawsuit against us in U.S. District Court, District of Utah, alleging that our technology directly and indirectly infringes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	six
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;patents that Vivint purchased. Vivint is seeking preliminary and permanent injunctions, enhanced damages and attorney&#8217;s fees. We answered the complaint on July 23, 2015. Among other things, we asserted defenses based on non-infringement and invalidity of the patents in question. Should Vivint prevail on its claims that
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;or more elements of our solution infringe
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;or more of its patents, we could be required to pay damages of Vivint&#8217;s lost profits and/or a reasonable royalty for sales of our solution, enjoined from making, using and selling our solution if a license or other right to continue selling such elements is not made available to us or we are unable to design around such patents, and required to pay ongoing royalties and comply with unfavorable terms if such a license is made available to us.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The outcome of the legal claim and proceeding against us cannot be predicted with certainty. We believe we have valid defenses to Vivint&#8217;s claims. Based on currently available information, we determined a loss is not probable or reasonably estimable at this time.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On February 9, 2016,&#160;we were sued along with one of our service providers in the Circuit Court for the City of Virginia Beach, Virginia by the estate of a deceased service provider customer alleging wrongful death, among other claims.&#160; The suit seeks a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in compensatory damages and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$350,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in punitive damages.&#160;We are currently reviewing this matter and have made no determination yet regarding the merits of the case.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	From time to time, we may be a party to litigation and subject to claims incident to the ordinary course of business. Although the results of litigation and claims cannot be predicted with certainty, we currently believe that the final outcome of these ordinary course matters will not have a material adverse effect on our business.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Other than the preceding matters, we are not a party to any lawsuit or proceeding that, in the opinion of management, is reasonably possible or probable of having a material adverse effect on our financial position, results of operations or cash flows. We reserve for contingent liabilities based on ASC 450, &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Contingencies
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,&#8221; when it is determined that a liability, inclusive of defense costs, is probable and reasonably estimable. Litigation is subject to many factors that are difficult to predict, so there can be no assurance that, in the event of a material unfavorable result in one or more claims, we will not incur material costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SBF4877B508AE58D6956017DEC83FE139">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 13. Employee Benefit Plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Employee Stock Purchase Plan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:5PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We adopted our 2015 ESPP in June 2015. Under the 2015 ESPP,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1,200,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares have been initially reserved for future grant with provisions established to increase the number of shares available on January 1 of each subsequent year for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	nine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;years. The annual automatic increase in the number of shares available for issuance under the 2015 ESPP is the lesser of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of each class of common stock outstanding as of December 31 of the preceding fiscal year,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1,500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock or such lesser number as determined by the board of directors. The 2015 ESPP allows eligible employees to purchase shares of our common stock at 90% of the fair market value, rounded up to the nearest cent, based on the closing price of our common stock on the purchase date. The maximum number of shares of our common stock that a participant may purchase during any calendar year shall not exceed such number of shares having a fair market value equal to the lesser of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$15,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of the participant's base compensation for that year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The 2015 ESPP is considered compensatory for purposes of share-based compensation expense due to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;discount on the fair market value of the common stock. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;purchases of shares as our first offering period under the
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;92
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

	plan ended on February 15, 2016. We recognized less than

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

Compensation expense is recognized for the amount of the discount, net of forfeitures, over the six-month purchase period, based on the monthly closing price of our common stock as an estimate of the final purchase price for the period. This estimate is adjusted monthly until the purchase is finalized. As of

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	401(k) Defined Contribution Plan
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We adopted the Alarm.com Holdings 401(k) Plan ("the Plan") on April 30, 2009. All of our employees are eligible to participate in the Plan. Our discretionary match for
</FONT>

	2015

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;maximum match. Our discretionary match for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of employee contributions up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of salary and up to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;maximum match. We recognized costs of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$1.0 million
</FONT>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Series B Redeemable Convertible Preferred Stock
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Upon completion of our IPO on July 1, 2015, all outstanding shares of redeemable convertible preferred stock converted into an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	35,017,884
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, we have no redeemable convertible preferred stock authorized or outstanding. Significant terms of Series B, B-1 and A redeemable convertible preferred stock prior to the completion of our IPO were as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In the event we declare a dividend, the Series B Preferred stockholders are entitled to receive dividends for each outstanding share of Series B Preferred on a pari passu basis with other stockholders, plus additional dividends equal to the declared dividend (the &#8220;Additional Dividends&#8221;). The Additional Dividends will be payable until such time as the Series B Preferred stockholders have been paid cumulative Additional Dividends in an aggregate amount equal to two fifths (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.40
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	) times the original issue price of the Series B Preferred shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Liquidation Preferences
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In the event of our liquidation or dissolution, the holders of Series B Preferred shares, along with holders of Series B-1 shares, will be paid out of the assets available before distribution or any payment is made to holders of Series A or Common. The liquidation preference is the greater of (1) a per share amount equal to one and two fifths (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	) times the original issue price per share, plus any declared but unpaid dividends, less any Series B Preferred Additional Dividends previously paid, or (2) the amount that would have been paid had all the preferred stockholders been converted into common.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Voting Rights
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Series B Preferred stockholders are entitled to cast the number of votes equal to the number of whole shares of common into which the Series B Preferred shares are convertible as of the record date of the vote. Certain actions of us, including mergers and acquisitions, dissolution, issuance of stock, declaration of dividends, the origination of debt, or amendments to our governing documents, requires the consent of a majority of the Series A stockholders, and Series B Preferred stockholders, voting as separate classes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conversion
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;93
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;" HREF="#ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SAB9468B74ED751D9BE5972D4050A393A">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ALARM.COM HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements - (Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Shares of Series B Preferred are convertible at the option of the holder into shares of common at any time and without the payment of additional consideration. All outstanding shares of Series B Preferred shall be converted automatically into common immediately upon the closing of an initial public offering of stock in which aggregate gross proceeds from the offering exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$75.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Each share of Series B Preferred will convert into the number of shares of common determined by dividing the original issuance price by the conversion price (&#8220;Series B Preferred Conversion Price&#8221;). In the event Series B Preferred is converted to common in connection with an initial public offering of our stock, the number of common shares to be issued depends in part on the initial public offering price of our common stock (the &#8220;IPO Price&#8221;). If our IPO Price is less than the Series B Preferred per share liquidation preference, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$11.74
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, then the number of common shares issued upon conversion will be determined using a conversion price equal to the Series B Preferred Conversion Price multiplied by a fraction equal to the IPO Price divided by the Series B Preferred liquidation preference per share (the &#8220;IPO Conversion Price&#8221;). The initial Series B Preferred Conversion Price was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$75.44
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share. On June 14, 2013, in conjunction with a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	nine-for-one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;forward split of our common shares, we amended our Certificate of Incorporation and adjusted the Series B Preferred Conversion Price to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$8.38222222
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share. The Series B Preferred Conversion Price will be further adjusted if we issue additional shares of our capital stock and the consideration per share is less than the Series B Preferred Conversion Price in effect immediately prior to the issuance of the additional shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Redemption
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In the event of certain capital transactions deemed to be liquidation events, the Series B Preferred stockholders may require the redemption of all outstanding Series B Preferred shares. In the event that the available proceeds from a liquidation event, or other available funds, are not sufficient to redeem all outstanding shares of Series B Preferred, we shall redeem a pro rata portion of each stockholder&#8217;s Series B Preferred shares along with a pro rata portion of each stockholder&#8217;s Series B-1 shares, on a pari passu basis, and we shall redeem the remaining shares as soon as adequate funds are available.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Series B-1 Redeemable Convertible Preferred Stock
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Dividend Preferences
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In the event we declare a dividend, the Series B-1 stockholders are entitled to receive dividends for each outstanding share of Series B-1 on a pari passu basis with other stockholders, plus Additional Dividends equal to the declared dividend. The Additional Dividends will be payable until such time the Series B-1 stockholders have been paid cumulative Additional Dividends in an aggregate amount equal to two fifths (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.40
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	) times the original issue price of the Series B-1 shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Liquidation Preferences
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In the event of our liquidation or dissolution, the holders of Series B-1 shares, along with holders of Series B Preferred shares, will be paid out of the assets available before distribution or any payment is made to holders of Series A or common. The liquidation preference is the greater of (1) a per share amount equal to one and two fifths (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	) times the original issue price per share, plus any declared but unpaid dividends, less any Series B-1 Additional Dividends previously paid, or (2) the amount that would have been paid had all the preferred stockholders been converted into common.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conversion
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Shares of Series B-1 are convertible at the option of the holder into shares of common at any time and without the payment of additional consideration. All outstanding shares of Series B-1 shall be converted automatically into common immediately upon the closing of an initial public offering of stock in which aggregate gross proceeds from the offering exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$75.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Each share of Series B-1 will convert into the number of shares of common determined by dividing the original issuance price by the conversion price (&#8220;Series B-1 Conversion Price&#8221;). In the event Series B-1 is converted to common in connection with an initial public offering of our stock, the number of common shares to be issued depends in part on the initial public offering price of our common stock (the &#8220;IPO Price&#8221;). If our IPO Price is less than the Series B-1 per share liquidation preference, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$11.74
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, then the number of common shares issued upon conversion will be determined using a conversion price equal to the Series B-1 Conversion Price multiplied by a fraction equal to the IPO Price divided by the Series B-1 liquidation preference per share (the &#8220;IPO Conversion Price&#8221;). The initial Series B-1 Conversion Price was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$75.44
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share. On June 14, 2013, in conjunction with a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	nine-for-one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;forward split of our common shares, we amended our Certificate of Incorporation and adjusted the Series B-1 Conversion Price to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$8.38222222
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share. The Series B-1 Conversion Price will be further adjusted if we issue additional shares of our capital stock and the consideration per share is less than the Series B-1 Conversion Price in effect immediately prior to the issuance of the additional shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

</FONT>

	In the event of certain capital transactions deemed to be liquidation events, the Series B-1 stockholders may require the redemption of all outstanding Series B-1 shares. In the event that the available proceeds from a liquidation event, or other
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ALARM.COM HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements - (Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	available funds, are not sufficient to redeem all outstanding shares of Series B-1 stock, we shall redeem a pro rata portion of each shareholder&#8217;s Series B-1 shares along with a pro rata portion of each stockholder&#8217;s Series B Preferred shares, on a pari passu basis, and we shall redeem the remaining shares as soon as adequate funds are available.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Series A Redeemable Convertible Preferred Stock
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Liquidation Preferences
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In the event of our liquidation or dissolution, the holders of Series A shares will be paid out of the assets available before distribution or any payment is made to holders of common, but after satisfaction of the liquidation preferences of the Series B Preferred and Series B-1 stockholders. The liquidation preference is the greater of (1) the original issue price of the preferred stock plus a Series A additional preference equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	8.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per annum on the original issue price accruing on a daily basis from the original issuance date and until the date such Series A shares are liquidated, plus accrued and unpaid dividends, or (2) the amount that would have been paid had all the preferred stock holders been converted into Common.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Voting Rights
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Series A stockholders are entitled to cast the number of votes equal to the number of whole shares of common into which the Series A shares are convertible as of the record date of the vote. Certain of our actions, including mergers and acquisitions, dissolution, issuance of stock, declaration of dividends, the origination of debt, or amendments to our governing documents, requires the consent of a majority of the Series A stockholders, and Series B Preferred stockholders, voting as separate classes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Conversion
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Shares of Series A are convertible at the option of the holder into shares of common at any time and without the payment of additional consideration. All outstanding shares of Series A will automatically convert into shares of common immediately upon the closing of an initial public offering of stock in which aggregate gross proceeds from the offering exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$75.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Each share of Series A will convert into the number of shares of common determined by dividing the original issuance price by the conversion price (&#8220;Series A Conversion Price&#8221;). The initial Series A Conversion Price was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$10.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share. On June 14, 2013, in conjunction with a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	nine-for-one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;forward split of our common shares, we amended our Certificate of Incorporation and adjusted the Series A Conversion Price to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$1.11111111
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share. The Series A Conversion Price will be further adjusted if we issue additional shares of our capital stock and the consideration per share is less than the Series A Conversion Price in effect immediately prior to the issuance of the additional shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Redemption
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In the event of certain capital transactions deemed to be liquidation events, the Series A stockholders may require the redemption of all outstanding Series A shares, subject to and following payment in full of the amounts payable to Series B Preferred and Series B-1 stockholders. In the event that the available proceeds from a liquidation event, or other available funds, are not sufficient to redeem all outstanding shares of Series A, we shall redeem a pro rata portion of each stockholder&#8217;s Series A and we shall redeem the remaining shares as soon as adequate funds are available.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Dividend
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On June 12, 2015, our board of directors declared a cash dividend on our common and preferred stock in the amount of (1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.36368
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share of common stock (see Note 15) and Series A preferred stock and (2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.72736
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share of Series B preferred stock and Series B-1 preferred stock or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$20.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in the aggregate, which we refer to as the 2015 Dividends. The 2015 Dividends were paid to our stockholders of record as of June 12, 2015 and were paid in June 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_S9D6DC06B708B4995A835D79422EA898D">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 15. Stockholders&#8217; equity / (deficit)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We are authorized to issue
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;classes of stock, common stock and preferred stock. On June 9, 2015, the board of directors amended and restated our Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation, effective upon the closing of our IPO, and authorized us to issue up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	300,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	10,000,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of undesignated preferred stock. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	45.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock issued, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	45.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock outstanding, respectively. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, there were no preferred shares issued and outstanding.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Upon completion of our IPO on July 1, 2015, all outstanding shares of redeemable convertible preferred stock (see Note 14) converted into an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	35,017,884
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock. Additionally, we issued
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	7,525,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock in our IPO.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Each outstanding share of common stock is entitled to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;vote per share.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL NARROW;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;95
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;" HREF="#ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SAB9468B74ED751D9BE5972D4050A393A">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ALARM.COM HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements - (Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 16. Stock-Based Compensation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Stock Options
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In June 2015, our board of directors adopted, our stockholders approved, and we registered the shares for our 2015 Equity Incentive Plan (the "2015 Plan"), pursuant to which we reserved and registered
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	4,700,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock for issuance to our employees, directors and non-employee directors and consultants. The registration included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	141,222
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock previously reserved for issuance under our Amended and Restated 2009 Stock Incentive Plan (the "2009 Plan") that were added to the shares reserved under the 2015 Plan upon its effectiveness. The 2015 Plan provides for the grant of incentive stock options to employees and for the grant of nonqualified stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock awards, restricted stock unit awards, performance-based stock awards, and other forms of equity compensations to employees, directors and non-employee directors and consultants. The number of shares of common stock reserved for issuance under the 2015 Plan will automatically increase on January 1 each year, for a period of not more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;years, commencing on January 1, 2016 through January 1, 2024, by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of the total number of shares of common stock outstanding on December 31st of the preceding calendar year, or a lesser number of shares as may be determined by the board of directors. As a result of the adoption of the 2015 Plan,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;further grants may be made under the 2009 Plan described below. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	4,663,399
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares remained available for future grant under the 2015 Plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The 2015 Plan (and the previous 2009 Plan) allow for the granting of incentive stock options to employees and for the granting of nonqualified stock options and restricted stock to our employees, directors and non-employee directors and consultants. Stock options under the 2015 Plan have been granted at exercise prices based on the closing price of our common stock on the date of grant. Stock options under the previous 2009 Plan have been granted at exercise prices as determined by the board of directors to our officers and employees. These stock options generally vest over a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	-year period and each option, if not exercised or terminated, expires on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	th anniversary of the grant date.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The 2015 Plan (and the previous 2009 Plan) allow for the granting of options that may be exercised before the options have vested. Unvested shares issued as a result of early exercise are subject to repurchase by us upon termination of employment or services at the original exercise price. The proceeds from the early exercise of stock options are initially recorded as a current liability and are reclassified to common stock and additional paid-in capital as the awards vest and our repurchase right lapses. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and 2014, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	96,368
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	209,372
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;unvested shares of common stock outstanding subject to our right of repurchase. During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, we repurchased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	287
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;unvested shares of common stock related to early exercised stock options in connection with employee terminations. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, we recorded $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in accounts payable, accrued expenses and other current liabilities on the consolidated balance sheets for the proceeds from the early exercise of the unvested stock options.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Included in the stock-based compensation expense for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;related to the cash settlement of recently exercised stock options of a terminated employee, at the company's election. We accounted for this cash settlement as a liability modification of the stock option awards.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We account for stock-based compensation awards based on the fair value of the award as of the grant date. We recognize stock-based compensation expense using the accelerated attribution method, net of estimated forfeitures, in which compensation cost for each vesting tranche in an award is recognized ratably from the service inception date to the vesting date for that tranche.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The following table summarizes the components of non-cash stock-based compensation expense (in thousands):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_47"></A>

</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	We value our stock options using the Black-Scholes option pricing model, which requires the input of subjective assumptions, including the risk-free interest rate, expected term, expected stock price volatility and dividend yield. The risk-free interest rate assumption is based upon observed interest rates for constant maturity U.S. Treasury securities consistent with the expected term of our stock options. The expected term represents the period of time the stock options are expected to be outstanding and is based on the &#8220;simplified method.&#8221; Under the &#8220;simplified method,&#8221; the expected term of an option is presumed to be the mid-point between the vesting date and the end of the contractual term. We use the &#8220;simplified method&#8221; due to the lack of sufficient historical exercise data to provide a reasonable basis upon which to otherwise estimate the expected term of the stock options. Expected volatility is based on historical volatilities for publicly traded stock of comparable companies over the estimated expected term of the stock options.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;The following table summarizes the assumptions used for estimating the fair value of stock options granted for the years ended December&#160;31:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The dividends declared and paid in June 2015 were in anticipation of our IPO, which we closed on July 1, 2015. Subsequent to the IPO, we do not expect to declare or pay dividends on a recurring basis. As such, we assume that the dividend rate is zero.
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015

	, 2014 and 2013 was $

	5.90

	,

	$4.20

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$4.02

	. The total fair value of stock options vested during the years ended
</FONT>

	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,

	2014

	&#32;and 2013 was $
</FONT>

	2.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and

	$0.5 million
</FONT>

	. The aggregate intrinsic value of stock options exercised during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	3.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, $
</FONT>

	7.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and

<A NAME="ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SC99B714BB4905D848F78309F80BEBEDD">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;" HREF="#ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SAB9468B74ED751D9BE5972D4050A393A">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ALARM.COM HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements - (Continued)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	In 2010, we issued performance-based warrants to two of our executive officers that gives these individuals the right to purchase up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	841,896
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock in the aggregate if certain performance targets and market conditions are achieved. In 2012, we issued an additional performance-based warrant to an executive officer that gives that executive officer the right to purchase up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	27,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock if certain performance targets and market conditions are achieved. On March 30, 2015, we issued performance-based warrants to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;employees. These warrants give these individuals the right to purchase up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	54,694
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock in the aggregate if certain performance targets are achieved.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The first performance-based warrant for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	750,015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock has an initial exercise price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.001
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;separate tranches of shares become exercisable upon the occurrence of a triggering event, which is defined as: (1) a change in control event that results in any person or entity (other than our stockholders immediately prior to the transaction) owning more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of the combined voting power of all classes of our capital stock, (2) a sale of substantially all of our assets, (3) an initial public offering, or (4) a liquidation or other dissolution of the Company. Upon the occurrence of a triggering event, the number of shares that become exercisable under the warrant is determined by the amount of cash consideration received by ABS Capital Partners, one of our stockholders, as a result of such triggering event. On July 11, 2012, we modified the terms of the performance-based warrant to provide for a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;cash payment in the event that a triggering event has not occurred on or before January 3, 2013. We considered this to be an equity to cash settled liability modification and recorded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in compensation expense, included within general and administrative expense, on the modification date. The award was settled for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;on January 3, 2013.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The second performance-based warrant for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	91,881
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock has an exercise price of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	0.41
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share and becomes exercisable if we have a change in control or if we complete an initial public offering. This warrant for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	91,881
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock expired in May 2015 upon the cessation of the holder of the warrant's employment with us.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The third performance-based warrant for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	27,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock has an exercise price of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3.89
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share and becomes exercisable if we have a change in control or if we complete an initial public offering. This warrant expired in July 2015 because the minimum annual revenue and EBITDA targets of the subsidiary unit required under the warrant were not met during the exercise period. The exercise period began upon the occurrence of a triggering event, which was upon the effectiveness of the registration statement for our IPO, and closed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;days after the effectiveness of our registration statement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	The fourth and fifth performance-based warrants, each for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	27,347
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock, have an exercise price of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	10.97
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share and we may elect to terminate the warrants in exchange for a one-time cash settlement in the event of a change in control. If the warrants become exercisable, the number of shares that become exercisable which cannot exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	27,347
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#160;shares for each warrant, is based upon the achievement of certain minimum annual revenue targets. These warrants will expire upon the earlier of March 2025 and the date upon which the holder of the warrant is no longer our employee or an employee of an affiliate of ours. We believe that the achievement of the minimum annual revenue targets is probable, and we began recognizing expense related to these performance-based warrants on April 1, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and 2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	none
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of the warrants that remained outstanding were exercisable because the performance requirements had not been met.&#160;We recorded less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;expense associated with the performance-based warrants during the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and we did not record expense associated with the performance-based warrants during the years ended December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and 2013.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Sale of Common Stock Subscriptions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	On May 22, 2013, we sold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	238,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock to one of our executive officers for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.95
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share, an amount below fair value. Under the terms of the sale, we had the right to repurchase the shares for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.95
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;per share subject to certain triggering events prior to April 2, 2017. Our repurchase right expired on July 1, 2015, the date of the closing of our IPO. The excess of the fair value over the sale price was being recorded to stock-based compensation expense, on a straight-line basis, over the four-year term of the repurchase agreement. In 2015, we recognized the remaining unamortized expense upon the expiration of our repurchase right. For the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, we recognized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;in general and administrative expense in our consolidated statement of operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SBDD51DA007D85273B5630E7DE56DB6F5">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	Note 17. Earnings Per Share
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	Basic and Diluted Earnings Per Share
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	The components of basic and diluted EPS are as follows (in thousands, except share and per share amounts):

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ALARM.COM HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements - (Continued)
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 18. Significant Service Providers
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	s ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;largest revenue service providers accounted for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	63%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	65%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	66%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of our revenue. One of our service providers individually represented greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	15%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;but not more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of our revenue for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Two of our service providers individually represented greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;but not more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	15%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of our revenue for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. One of our service providers individually represented greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;but not more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	15%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of our revenue for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;TEXT-INDENT:32PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	Trade accounts receivable from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;service providers totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	$2.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;other individual service provider represented more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;of accounts receivable as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	. Trade accounts receivable from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;service providers totaled $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	1.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	, as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;other individual service provider represented more than 10% of accounts receivable as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="ALARMCOM10-K2015DEC312015_HTM_SEC2045DF4D1156FBBA3973497D1167DF">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 19. Income Taxes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

	&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;The components of our income tax expense for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>

	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	&#32;are as follows (in thousands):
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ALARM.COM HOLDINGS, INC.
</FONT>

</TD>
